content.title: Term Loan Scheme- Credit Line 2 for Minority Community
content.department: Haryana Backward Classes and Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam
content.details: The scheme 'Term Loan Scheme- Credit Line 2 for Minority Community' is implemented by the Haryana Backward Classes and Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, loans of up to ₹30,00,000/- are provided at a concessional interest rate to individuals from minority communities to enhance their employability. This applies to those with an annual family income between ₹98,001/- and ₹8,00,000/- in rural areas and ₹1,20,001/- and ₹8,00,000/- in urban areas. Applicants must be permanent residents of Haryana and belong to minority communities, including Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Buddhists, Parsis, and Jains.
benefits: Loans of up to ₹30,00,000/- at a concessional interest rate to enhance employability.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The applicant should be between 18 and 55 years of age.
The annual family income of the applicant should be between ₹98,001/- and ₹8,00,000/- in rural areas and between ₹1,20,001/- and ₹8,00,000/- in urban areas.
The applicant should belong to a minority community, i.e., Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Buddhists, Parsis, and Jains.
The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP ID).
documents_required: Resident Proof/Address Proof/Ownership Proof i.e. Haryana Domicile Certificate

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount one can avail under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can avail loans up to ₹30,00,000/-.

faqs.question: Which minority communities are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Buddhists, Parsis, and Jains.

faqs.question: What is the age limit for applicants of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants should be between 18 and 55 years of age.

faqs.question: What is the income criteria for rural applicants?
faqs.answer: Rural applicants should have an annual family income between ₹98,001/- and ₹8,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the income criteria for urban applicants?
faqs.answer: Urban applicants should have an annual family income between ₹1,20,001/- and ₹8,00,000/-.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for applicants to have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP ID)?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants must have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP ID).

faqs.question: How can eligible applicants apply for the loan?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply online through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://saralharyana.gov.in/.

faqs.question: Is there an offline application process for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applications are accepted only through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.

faqs.question: Can applicants track their application status?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants can track their application status through the Official Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://status.saralharyana.nic.in/.

faqs.question: Can non-residents of Haryana apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only permanent residents of Haryana are eligible to apply.
